intro: Talauma minor subsp. oblongifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf talauma, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are often glossy and arranged alternately along the stem. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as montane forests. Its botanical features make it an important component of the understory vegetation in its native habitat.
